t: Psalm 71
Forsake Me Not When My Strength Is Spent
In*pn you, O Lord,*s do I take refuge; let*ld me never be put to shame!
In*ln your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; incline*ld your ear to me, and save me!
Be*ln to me a rock of refuge, to*ld which I may continually come; you*ln have given the command to save me, for*ld you are my rock and my fortress.
Rescue*pn me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked, from*ld the grasp of the unjust and cruel man.
For*ln you, O Lord, are my hope, my*ld trust, O Lord,*s from my youth.
Upon*ln you I have leaned from before my birth; you*ld are he who took me from my mother’s womb. My*ln praise is continually of you.
I*pn have been as a portent to many, but*ld you are my strong refuge.
My*ln mouth is filled with your praise, and*ld with your glory all the day.
Do*ln not cast me off in the time of old age; forsake*ld me not when my strength is spent.
For*ln my enemies speak concerning me; those*ld who watch for my life consult together
and*ln say, “God has forsaken him; pursue*ld and seize him, for*ld there is none to deliver him.”
O*pn God, be not far from me; O*ld my God, make haste to help me!
May*ln my accusers be put to shame and consumed; with*ld scorn and disgrace may they be covered who*ld seek my hurt.
But*ln I will hope continually and*ld will praise you yet more and more.
My*ln mouth will tell of your righteous acts, of*ld your deeds of salvation all the day, for*ld their number is past my knowledge.
With*ln the mighty deeds of the Lord God*s I will come; I*ld will remind them of your righteousness, yours alone.
O*pn God, from my youth you have taught me, and*ld I still proclaim your wondrous deeds.
So*ln even to old age and gray hairs, O*ld God, do not forsake me, until*ln I proclaim your might to another generation, your*ld power to all those to come.
Your*ln righteousness, O God, reaches*ld the high heavens. You*ln who have done great things, O*ld God, who is like you?
You*ln who have made me see many troubles and calamities will*ld revive me again; from*ln the depths of the earth you*ld will bring me up again.
You*ln will increase my greatness and*ld comfort me again.
I*pn will also praise you with the harp for*ld your faithfulness, O my God; I*ln will sing praises to you with the lyre, O*ld Holy One of Israel.
My*ln lips will shout for joy, when*ld I sing praises to you; my*ld soul also, which you have redeemed.
And*ln my tongue will talk of your righteous help all the day long, for*ln they have been put to shame and disappointed who*ld sought to do me hurt.
